body:
Comment 4 by **abdul.h.chaudhry**: 
I understand go strings have an explicit length and no need for null terminating strings.

Its the definition of equals that I have a problem with.

If the strings are of different length but equal up to the zeros then they should be
considered the same even if the lengths differ due to extra zeros.

I have an issue with the 0's padded at the end - having them at the end does not seem to
imply any difference.

Maybe, this will cause a lot of "issues". I have no idea what they are but would be
curious to know so I can understand this better.
